Pre-Game Insights: The Milwaukee Brewers (76-56) are traveling to Great American Ball Park on Friday where they will meet the Cincinnati Reds (63-70).
The expected starting pitchers will be Colin Rea for the Brewers and Nick Martínez for the Reds.
Milwaukee has a slugging percentage of .404 and have struck out 1,162 times, while drawing a walk on 493 occasions.
The Brewers have recorded 200 two-baggers as a team and have hit 141 baseballs out of the park.
As a unit, the Milwaukee Brewers are recording 4.8 runs per game, which is 9th in baseball.
Brewers pitchers have surrendered 163 home runs and 523 total runs (3rd in baseball).
The Brewers have an earned run average of 3.70 on the season (3rd in MLB), and their staff has struck out 1,073 hitters.
The Brewers bullpen have accumulated a save percentage of 70.5% and has stepped onto the mound in 128 save situations.
The Milwaukee Brewers have accumulated 3,515 putouts this season, as well as 1,114 assists and 68 errors.
The Brewers have transformed 71.1% of balls hit into play into outs out of 10,545 innings, which ranks them 3rd in the majors.
Rea has taken the ball for 421 innings and has earned 344 strikeouts so far in his pro baseball career.
The Reds hold a slugging % of .399 and they score 4.47 runs per contest (15th in MLB).
Cincinnati has accounted for 154 home runs for the season as well as 563 runs batted in.
The Cincinnati Reds have an OBP of .304 as well as a team batting average of .232 this season.
The Reds hold a team WHIP of 1.251 in addition to having a FIP of 4.19 as a pitching staff so far this season.
The Cincinnati pitching staff have conceded 569 runs so far this season while holding an ERA of 4.09 (532 earned runs given up).
Their K/BB ratio is 8.70 (1,130 strikeouts vs 401 walks).
Cincinnati relief pitchers hold an inherited score rate of 29.3% out of their 184 inherited base runners.
The Reds have racked up 1,008 assists, 85 errors and have accounted for 3,513 putouts on the season.
Martinez has surrendered 752 base knocks while accumulating 521 strikeouts in 736 innings pitched.
Martinez (33-44 record in his career) has a 4.22 ERA and has given up 9.2 hits per 9 innings.
